headline: Extra Easy Hummus
description: Tahini-free hummus that only takes minutes, and is a favorite with my kids.

video.description: Healthy dip made from garbanzo beans.
video.name: Extra Easy Hummus

name: Extra Easy Hummus
recipeIngredient: 1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained, liquid reserved

recipeInstructions.text: In a blender or food processor combine garbanzo beans, garlic, cumin, salt and olive oil. Blend on low speed, gradually adding reserved bean liquid, until desired consistency is achieved.

review.reviewBody: Very easy to make.. I cut down on the cumin a little but it was very good humus

Lol the 1st time I made hummus I put alot off garlic in ......like 6 gloves. I live pretty much by my self. I didn't notice garlic was coming thru my pours an breath. I was in the car with a girlfriend an she had do open both window. The garlic smell was burning her eyes .... I'm making tonite, I'm to go easy on the garlic this time !
This was a nice fast & easy recipe! I added a squeeze of fresh lemon juice. My family loved it. I will make sure i throw garbanzo beans on my camping list, for a last minute snack!
Sesame is an important flavor for hummus. I substitute toasted sesame oil for the olive oil. Amazing difference.
Turned out great!

Nope. No one here liked this version. Way too much cumin. Not enough salt and definitely could benefit from one more clove of garlic and at least a half tablespoon of sesame oil if you're leaving out the tahini paste.
add a little lemon juice
I just discovered hummus and wanted to make my own. This was real simple and tasty.

I had to add extra olive oil to get it to puree in my instantpot blender but it was wonderful. My daughter can't eat tahina and she loved this ! In fact she took all the leftover home with her! I will be making this all the time!

I have been making this recipe for over a year now.
Very quick and simple when you need to snack Now!
I have served this at get togethers and folks seem to enjoy it. Folks have even asked for the recipe.

This is a really good recipe! I agree with one of the other reviewers who suggested sesame oil instead of olive oil for that "real" hummus flavor. Absolutely perfect with baby carrots and celery!! Yum!!
Needed a lot of extra seasonings, after the tune-up, it was pretty good.
Have made as instructed and was very happy. Second time I added some lemon juice and sesame oil and enjoyed it that way as well. Thank you for a quick, easy and healthy alternative to store bought
Awesome!! Replaced garlic with fresh chilies...for extra zing!!

I used avocado oil instead of olive oil because that’s what I had on hand, but followed the rest of the directions as-is, but it was kind of bland, except that the garlic was too strong. I’ve made a better tahini-free hummus using another recipe here on allrecipes, but can’t seem to find it now.
OMG! So yummy and easy!
Very simple...first time I made hummus and appreciate the simplicity...turned out tasty...added couple more garlic cloves and olive oil...delicious.
didn"t have cumin so used chipole
It seemed a bit salty to me. Next time I make it, I'll cut the salt in half.
I’ll never buy store-bought again!
I made it really smooth and I would add less cumin, but I would definitely make this dip again!
I made it really smooth and I would add less cumin, but I would definitely make this dip again!
Was very creamy after 15 minutes in the food processor. Would use less cumin and salt.
Always a favorite !! Very easy and tasty.

Super quick and easy to make. I substituted 1 tbsp of sesame oil for the olive oil. As well I only used 1 tsp of cumin and added the juice from 1/2 lemon. So good - my husband went back for multiple helpings.

QUICK and EASY to make! It isn't quite as creamy as store bought but STILL GOOD! Also YOU KNOW what is in it and it is FRESH, None of all those emulsifiers and junk!, I ADDED: 1/8 cup lemon juice, used 1 large and 2 small cloves garlic, and a PINCH of red pepper flakes for a little kick. I ONLY used 1 tsp ground cumin. Did add a little of the reserved drained liquid to make it creamier and thinner.
Very easy to make. It was very good as written. after tasting, I did add the juice of half a lemon because I like the flavor,
I substituted seasame oil and added fried onions. So good.
As many of the reviewers said, I substituted sesame oil for the oil the recipe calls for. I now make this version of hummus rather than the ones that use tahini. Much easier and tastes great.
Love it. Very easy healthy snack. I ended up using 2 cans of garbanzo beans though as I found it too salty/garlicy with just one. Will use this recipe over and over again!
Super easy!! I added a roasted bell pepper for colour and flavour:-)

Tried it myself. I figured out later that it's actually meant to be used as dip by a friend... oops. Well, it came out just as described... which was surprising considering what the ingredients were. I personally don't enjoy it, but my teacher and classmates do.
tried to adjust garlic too much lime instesd was ok just need to try again
Very easy recipe and readily available ingredients. I really enjoyed the flavour with peanut butter as opposed to tahini.
I made it leaving out the garlic and increasing the cumin and lemon juice. It was easy and good and I am thrilled to have hummus again! Thahini was always a problem as I do not eat sesame!

I first followed the original recipe, but it was very bland and a lot like baby food. So I tried more garlic and I added crushed red pepper , some parsley, and sun dried tomatoes and a tablespoon of cream cheese for a smoother creamy texture and it turned out amazing!
good easy recipe
I followed the directions exactly but it had no flavor. Added extra garlic and cumin to get some flavor from it but still rather bland. Just not to my liking.

Delicious!! I have severe food allergies and sesame is on that list. I added 1 tablespoon of lemon juice and found this to be delicious. I think the trick is to use a really good olive oil the best you can afford to mimic the missing sesame oil taste. Sesame is very potent which is what most people are looking for in a good humus. I used carlino olive oil drizzling the top with extra oil and a sprinkle of sun dried tomatoes. Delicious with vegetables and homemade pita.
So easy and delicious!
I added avocados and salsa and used green peppers to dip in it. Worked out great!
This is a good “go to” recipe. I like that it is basic and customizable. I will be adding more garlic next time.

Quick and easy recipe. I doubled the recipe. I reduced the cumin to .5 tsp for 2 cans of beans. The cumin was still very strong. I used 1.5 small meyer lemon sqeezed and 3 garlic cloves. I used the suggested amount of olive oil and the texture is too oily. I also added .25 cup of the drained can bean juice for a smoother consistency . I Will definately make again but next time I will try fresh dry garbanzo beans.

Quick and easy recipe. I doubled the recipe. I reduced the cumin to .5 tsp for 2 cans of beans. The cumin was still very strong. I used 1.5 small meyer lemon sqeezed and 3 garlic cloves. I used the suggested amount of olive oil and the texture is too oily. I also added .25 cup of the drained can bean juice for a smoother consistency . I Will definately make again but next time I will try fresh dry garbanzo beans.

Very easy as titled, but a bit too much cumin. I did end up adding lemon juice and also some sour cream I had around to dampen down that strong flavor a bit. Next time, I'll knock the cumin back to 1 tsp. If you don't like tahini as an add-in, you can use any kind of nutter butter you prefer instead or leave it out as this recipe does.
Made it without the parsley since I didn't have it. It was still great and got gone quick, will definitely be making again.

What an easy recipe to make ! I just love that it doesn't need the Tahini .....
Simple to make , great taste and the family loves it...I didn't change a thing....Will definitely make it again soon :)
No added salt needed.
This was very good for only taking 5 minutes to prepare! I also added 1/2 tsp paprika, 1 tsp garam masala and upped the olive oil. The garam masala especially gave this a lot of flavor.
Delicious! Way better than store bought and super easy to make.

This is a solid, base recipe and since I didn't have tahini I wanted to use a recipe that didn't include it. I used dry beans instead of canned so you'll have to do the conversion. I started with the basics and adjusted based on my preferences. The only thing I added was red pepper. So many creative ways to work with this but a great foundation to build from. My kids loved it!

After making once as is (very good), took the advice of many others: halve the cumin, double the garlic, add 1 scant teaspoon sesame oil, and add the juice and zest of 1/2 a lemon. Absolutely delicious!!!
Yuck. Way too much cumin flavor. Added more garlic and some lemon and it helped. Wouldn't make it again.
I guess I am NOT a cumin fan. If you are a cumin fan then you will probably love it! :)
I like cumin but this was overpowering. Needed some lemon juice.
Easy and delicious!

Read the notes; they are absolutley helpful. I halved the cumin, doubled the garlic, squirted in some lemon juice, lessened the salt - I love seasoning, but I'm trying to lower my salt intake, so do what you need to do with that - added a dash of black pepper, a pinch of cayenne and some sesame seeds. It was really good.

It was so easy! I modified it just a little. Instead of the juice from the chick pea can, I used Jalapeno juice and chopped up Jalapenos and the carrots and onions found in the Jalapenos can. I also added some Chipotle seasoning. It is fabulous!!!!
Fantastic, quick, easy recipe - I also added paprika and lemon juice after reading the comments and it turned out delicious.

I had to add another garlic clove to the hummus to actually get flavor in it. It was bland. I added some spices and more salt, and it was much better. I probably would make this again, but using two garlic cloves, more olive oil, and less bean liquid.
Just added more garlic.
suggest 2:1 olive to sesame oil (I did 3 tsp total) and the T of Lemon juice. Also, you get a much creamier consistency if you remove most of the chickpea skins. Excellent!
Added chopped scallions and a bit more cumin. I'll be making this again!

This was so good and fast! I did make some changes like I found on another review. I used 2 cloves of crushed garlic, about 1/2 teaspoon of ground cumin, a splash of lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon of smoked paparica, 1/2 teaspoon of dill, 1 tablespoon of olive oil and just a touch of the drained liquid. It was very good.
I used sesame oil and it gave it a wonderful flavor. Next time I think I will add a little lemon juice also.
it need less liquid but it taste good
This does not taste like hummus at all! This is basically a chickpea spread with too much cumin.

Very easy to make, but far too much cumin for my liking. I recommend reducing the cumin to 1 tablespoon and upping the garlic. 

Because there was too much cumin I turned it into a jalapeno hummus to salvage it.

This is my go-to hummus recipe. I am not a fan of tahini flavor, so this was perfect. It is excellent as written, with the addition of the juice of half a lemon. Sometimes I choose to increase the garlic, and I almost always sprinkle in a little extra cumin (just because I love it!) My favorite addition was a jar of roasted red peppers, which made the most delicious hummus. I, too, serve it either with veggies or I make my own pita chips to go with it. Thank you so much for this fantastic recipe!

I made this, and it was great. I followed the advice of others. I love garlic, so I add an addition clove. I found a container of marinated garlic, in the grocery store so I used that. I also, put in marinated artichokes, hot pepper flakes, and a few drops of fresh lemon juice. I did half the cumin. Well make again!!!!!

Delish. Simple too. My crudite appetizers just got a bit fresher, more economical, and less processed. Thanks for the recipe. I suspect that additions could give it different personalities, olive, pine nut, lemon, roasted red pepper, etc. I will definitely make this again.
not bad. I opted for 2 cloves of garlic, 2 tsp cumin, 1 tbls sesame oil, squeeze of lemon juice and reserved bean juice for consistency I preferred
My husband and I loved this recipe. It goes perfect with homemade pita chips
Loved it! I followed the instructions to half the cumin and add the lemon juice.

This was a pretty tasty hummus. I couldn't believe how quick and easy it was. I didn't miss the tahini at all. The cumin wasn't overpowering. It was quite garlicky, but I liked that. I let it sit for a few hours before eating to let the flavors meld and then drizzled some extra virgin olive oil on top to serve. Very impressed!

Really good! Great alternative for my son, who is allergic to sesame. I added a little extra olive oil and a few squeezes of lemon. The one garlic clove I used ended up being too strong for my son, but I will make this again with less garlic for him. I think I would love some chopped olives or pickled jalapeños in this for myself!

This is an incredibly easy recipe. I prefer this recipe than those that require tahini. Even the husbund aproves! Adding a bit of lemon juice and Hungarian paprika helps kick up the flavor. For those who enjoy a strong garlic flavor, add about 3-4 cloves.

Pretty Good recipe. I did do a few minor changes. I took the advice of a few others and added 1 TBL lemon juice. I used 1 Tsp garlic granules and 1/2 tsp garlic salt and doubled the cumin. Sprinkled a little paprika on top for garnish. Everyone ate it up.
I added lemon juice and black bean garlic sauce if I have it. I've also used a tri bean blend. This recipe is so universal and a hit every time!
Didn't taste good. I thought it was bland, and didn't like it. I'll have to keep trying
It was quite good but I did make a few changes. I added have squeezed lemon, some chili powder, chili flakes and paprika. I also doubled the garlic and halved the cumin.
Fantastic! I loved it as written! Economical too.
I make this same recipe at home! Though I add White Pepper to compliment to smokey/savory Cumin and I add Sesame oil to replace the Tahini flavor.

Omg, this was SOO easy. And I am curses in the kitchen. I might use less cumin next time but that is just a personal taste issue. This is a GREAT base recipe to use for flavored hummus. Can't wait to add black olives! Thank you for this. Also very kid friendly.
Nice and easy! Lots of room to add your own flavors and tastes.

AWESOME recipe! I LOVE hummus but I almost never have tahini on hand to make it with so I end up having to buy premade stuff at the store. This recipe TOTALLY eliminates that! 

Two things I did differently. I added 1 TBSP of lemon juice (just the concentrated stuff I had in the fridge) and I used sesame oil instead of olive oil. It gave the finished hummus that sesame taste that is in traditional hummus without having to buy an expensive bottle of tahini.

I've also double the recipe and used 1 TBSP of sesame oil and 1 TBSP of olive oil and saw no difference in the taste. Everyone I've served this too is totally wowed by it.

Absolutely delicious!!! Much better than store-bought hummus. Like other users, I added 1T fresh squeezed lemon, an extra clove of garlic, and only 1t of cumin. I used 1.5C of frozen chickpeas that I had previously cooked and just added a bit of water. I used my blendtec twister jar to blend it and it turned out beautifully! Smooth and creamy. Next time I may try adding a little fresh jalapeno.

The only changes I made to this recipe was to add a little oregano and cayenne pepper. Didn't really use much of the bean liquid to avoid the preservative and reduce the sodium. Who needs store bought hummus when you can make your own. The only way thing better than canned beans is fresh ones, if you can get it!
If you want to make it less fattening, add a teaspoon or so of water while blending it. It will come out just as creamy, but without all the extra oil.
This is definitely extra easy! I had to add more of the spices and I added a little lemon juice. Was not disappointed. I would make this anytime I wanted hummus and didn't have tahini for sure.

I did like a few comments said and added a little bit of lemon juice and some water (didn't think and drained my beans before so couldn't use that). It was delicious though and my new favorite hummus!

I've made a recipe similar to this for years because I absolutely hate store-bought hummus...because of the overwhelming taste of tahini. I add a bit more garlic and olive oil to help with the consistency. I also add a splash of lemon juice and chopped sun-dried tomatoes. It's always a hit with family and friends. Thank you for this tahini-free recipe!

My almost 2 year old daughter can't have sesame but has always loved hummus. This was a terrific, easy recipe that she was eating with both hands and had all over her face - she was so pleased. I will probably reduce the salt a bit but that's just personal preference. Thanks so much for the easy delicious recipe!

I omitted the olive oil. It's not necessary. I halfed the cumin because 2 teaspoons seemed a bit much. 1 good sized clove of garlic is fine. I would only use 2 if they were small cloves. I used 3 tablespoons of the bean juice and added juice from half of a small lemon which was 1 tablespoon. Be careful with salting this as it is plenty salty to begin with from the beans. I blended it up in the blender tried it out and it was wonderful except for the lack of tahini. I added 2 drops of smoked sesame oil and reblended it. My girlfriend said it was the best hummus she'd ever had.
This is a great recipe. It's easy, and there are many different ways you can spice it up to your personal taste.

I just finished making this and I must say it was yummy(: I had a lot of cans of chickpeas in pantry that I needed to get rid of. So I needed something quick and easy this was a hit. I followed one of recommendations by doubling the garlic, cutting the ground cumin in half, and adding a dash of red pepper, and lemon juice ! Delicious(:
My very first home made hummus! I added extra garlic and it was fantastic!
As is,I did not care for this recipe. I'm sure with modifications it would be an ok starting point.
Cut the cumin in half, was delicious
